value: Designs for Ewers, from Dessins d'orfèvrerie (Designs for Metalwork)

label: Description
value: Fontainebleau school. Design for two ewers. On the left ewer, the Birth of Venus. On the right one, the Triumph of Neptune. Both are decorated with pearls, jewels and strapwork, crabs, frogs, lobsters, putti and grotesque masks.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Diverses pièces de serruriers (Various Designs for Locksmiths)

label: Description
value: This group includes the orginal suite of fourteen plates, including title plate and dedication plate, an additional two plates numbered 15 and 16, and a two-page spread with a portrait of Brisville.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Portrait of Hugues Brisville, from Diverses pièces de serruriers (Various Designs for Locksmiths)

label: Description
value: Self-portrait of Hugues Brisville set within an oval medallion enclosed by an ornamental frame composed of grotesques with masks and the heads of various animals; putti and the figures of Time and Minerva terminating in foliate scrolls. Brisville is depicted seated at a table by an open window with a piece of paper and holding a chalk holder and compass in his right hand, a view of a balcony, garden and wrought iron gates beyond. A frame of grotesques with acanthus rinceaux, bird heads, masks, and dogs. At the bottom, two figures with bodies terminating in acanthus leaves, representing Time and Minerva. The left figure, an older man, holds a scroll with a cipher, assisted by a winged child. The right figure wears antique style armor and holds a shield with a coat-of-arms, assisted by the half figure of a putto. At bottom center, an hourglass and owl perched on a flower. At center, the portrait of a man with long hair, seated at a ledge with paper and pen before him. Surrounding him are four winged figures; the one at top left holds a page and draughtman’s tools.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving and etching on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line

Title page, from Diverses pièces de serruriers (Various Designs for Locksmiths)

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle showing title and dedication within a cartouche composed of interlacing lines. At top center, the Longuet coat-of-arms and mask. The upper text remains the same as the 1662 edition (see: 1921-6-261-1). The lower text reads: A PARIS / Chez Meriette rue St. / Jacques aux Col.nes d’Hercule Privilege du Roy. At bottom, a faint lion mask and landscape.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1921: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Dedication page, from Diverses pièces de serruriers (Various Designs for Locksmiths)

label: Description
value: Dedication page printed in black. Above the text is the Longuet  coat-of-arms flanked on either side by a lion and an acanthus leaf. On top of the coat of arms is a frieze decorated with a piece of armor that is surrounded by foliage, and below the arms is a grotesque head. Dedication is to Monsieur Longuet, king's councilor.

Design for the Ceiling of the Salon of the Palazzo Spinola, Genoa

label: Description
value: An oval central panel shows the Apotheosis of Amrbose Spinola, being borne to heaven on a chariot. The outer edge of the ceiling is composed of segmented panels with vine tendril arabesques and putti. Columnar and pier supports are indicated at the outer edges.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Almanac for the First Half of the Year 1792

label: Description
value: An oblong medallion portrait is on top of every strip dedicated to a month. Represented are: king "Louis August XVI, du nom / Roi de France et de Navarre" (1754-1793); queen "Marie Antoinette d'Autriche / Reine de France." (1755-1793); the dauphin "Louis Charles / Prince Royale" (1785-1795); the princess "Marie Therese Charlotte de / France, Madame Iere"; the major of Paris, "Monsieur Bailly / Maire de Paris"; "Monsieur [Marquis de] la Fayette / Com.dant de la Garde Parisienne" (1757-1834).

value: Engraving and etching, brush and watercolor on paper

Plate 1, Title Plate, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 11, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 11, plate 11 of a series of 12. Design for a vase influenced by shell forms to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. The body, accentuated with rocky ribs and sea plant forms, rests upon a siren mermaid figure at left and a triton at right, their tails intertwined to form the base.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 12, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 12, plate 12 of a series of 12. Design for mounts of a ewer or vase influenced by shell forms to be executed in jasper. A figure of a young boy reclines on rocks, shells, and flowers on the lid, a goat with a long tail decorates the handle, and acanthus and scroll motifs adorn the foot. At right, a line drawing of the ewer to which the mounts would be attached.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 2, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 2, plate 2 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal with curving fluted forms, placed on a pedestal. Sacrificial lamb (pascal lamb) at top, head and wings of putto at either side. At front, a plaque in the form of an escutcheon with a figural scene featuring a bishop and supplicant. In the background, a frieze carved in relief near bottom. Above, an open sky with sunlight radiating beyond the lamb's body between groups of clouds.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 3, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 3, plate 3 of a series of 12. Folio 2, plate 2 of a series of 12. Design for a vase or perfume burner to be executed in metal with curving fluted forms, placed on a pedestal. Two climbing figures of putti decorate the lid. At the sides, busts of winged female figures. At the front, a shell-like form. Smoke clouds in the background. At the base of the vase, leafy branches.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 4, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 4, plate 4 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal with curving forms, placed on a pedestal. A shell-shaped lid is attached to the left handle by a chain, the handles composed of two rams’ heads decorated with snakes.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 5, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 5, plate 5 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal with curving shell-shaped forms, placed on a pedestal. The handles and lid are made up of the coils of two snakes.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 6, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 6, plate 6 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. Three putti figures support the vase on their backs. Decorating the vase, below the lid, are three lion’s masks connected by a festoon.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 7, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 7, plate 7 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. Shell-shaped forms near the neck and lid, the handle connected to the base by a snake-like chain. Sitting on the handle is a crouching dog baring its teeth. Reclining in the slope of the neck, at right, a putto figure.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 8, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 8, plate 8 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. On the body, a scene of four nude women. The handle at left is composed of a feathered bird stretched across the body of the vase, its neck forming the handle curve and its beak prying open the lid at top. The right handle a sharper geometric form resting upon a mask. Leafy garland draped from the right handle to the pedestal. Garden wall indicated in background.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
